findings.title: ST - Stops Transactions
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to stop the sales for all users excluding the whitelist address, allowing only a select few to transact and potentially operating as a honeypot.

findings.title: MT - Mints Tokens
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to mint tokens, which can lead to highly inflated contract tokens.

findings.title: BC - Blacklists Addresses
findings.description: The contract owner has the authority to stop addresses from transactions. The owner may take advantage of it by calling the `setBlacklist` function.

findings.title: MEE - Missing Events Emission
findings.description: The contract performs actions and state mutations from external methods that do not result in the emission of events.

findings.title: RSW - Redundant Storage Writes
findings.description: The contract updates the `whitelist` and `blacklist` status of an account even if its current state is the same as the one passed as an argument, resulting in redundant storage writes.

findings.title: RSK - Redundant Storage Keyword
findings.description: The contract uses the `storage` keyword in a view function which is redundant.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not follow the Solidity naming convention guidelines, which can affect readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L13 - Divide before Multiply Operation
findings.description: Performing divisions before multiplications may cause loss of prediction.

findings.title: L14 - Uninitialized Variables in Local Scope
findings.description: Using an uninitialized local variable can lead to unpredictable behavior and potentially cause errors in the contract.

findings.title: L15 - Local Scope Variable Shadowing
findings.description: Local scope variable shadowing occurs when a local variable with the same name as a variable in an outer scope is declared within a function or code block.

findings.title: L17 - Usage of Solidity Assembly
findings.description: Using assembly can be useful for optimizing code, but it can also be error-prone. It's important to carefully test and debug assembly code to ensure that it is correct and does not contain any errors.

findings.title: L18 - Multiple Pragma Directives
findings.description: If the contract includes multiple conflicting pragma directives, it may produce unexpected errors.

findings.title: L19 - Stable Compiler Version
findings.description: The `^` symbol indicates that any version of Solidity that is compatible with the specified version (i.e., any version that is a higher minor or patch version) can be used to compile the contract. The version lock is a mechanism that allows the author to specify a minimum version of the Solidity compiler that must be used to compile the contract code.
